journals.notes: In my opinion, we don't even need to keep the old huge fonts. Its the mod code so we can bring it up to date the way we want. The smaller text with shadowing enabled is much cleaner and easier to read.

There is actually one font used in game, but it's rendered in two different ways. The "old" one is blurry, and is also used extensively in scoreboard display. A second step could be to rework the scoreboard before getting rid of the duplicated code.

To do:
* -Enhance the crosshair names displaying.-
* Add another CenterPrint-like function (like etpub "Banner Print") or modify the existing one with an additional font size parameter. It could be used for the important server message (server restart...) or the "FIGHT" or "PREPARE TO FIGHT" with middle sized strings.
* Increase the "Config: Legacy Competition" string size. Ideally, it should be middle sized (see above).
* -Improve the small fonts rendering by registering the same font but on a smaller size (like it is achieved on the scoreboard).-
* -Merge some of the new cvars. There are way too many.-
* -Add some UI sliders and/or global settings that adjust all the cvars easily.-
* -Cleanup! If possible, replace all occurrences of Draw{Big,Small}String, DrawStrlen, DrawChar{,2} and DrawStrinExt{2,3} by their "clean" equivalent.-

At this time, I don't think it's very useful to add another CenterPrint function (bloated?), and I'd like to keep the fonts size cvar to a minimum only (actually down to 4), so I consider this feature fully done.

subject: improve in-game fonts rendering
description:
Currently, the fonts position and size are fixed and are simply scaled to the screen. This result in huge fonts on the screen while this is unnecessarily, especially when using higher resolution.

ETPub/Jaymod/Silent use smaller fonts, which are resizable if needed and are also easier to read. Implement some cg_fontsizeXXX to achieve a similar result. See screenshots below for an example of a first, quick implementation.

Note: ETPub implement a whole "Fonts" option panel to modify the size and the fonts used. I believe this is bloated, but a few size sliders with good default font size might do the trick.
